page.title: 11PLANT-LIFE AROUND W.BERGHOLT
page.content: {BINDWEED:}IT GETS ITS NAME FROM THE WAY IT GROWS.IT TWINES ITSELF ROUND OTHER PLANTS AND ITS WHITE FLOWERS BLOOM IN JUNE-JULY. {SCENTLESS MAYWEED:}DESPITE ITS NAME, IT DOES NOT FLOWER IN MAY BUT FROM JULY ONWARDS. IT HAS A DAISY LIKE FLOWER AND THE LEAVES ARE SPINDLY. IT GROWS IN DISTURBED PLACES AND BESIDE FIELDS. {HEDGE MUSTARD:}IT FLOWERS FROM MAY TO SEPTEMBER ANNUALLY, WITH SPREADING BRANCHES,PALE YELLOW IN COLOUR. GROWS ON WASTE PLACES AND HEDGE BANKS. {RED CAMPION:}THIS IS FOUND IN SHADY PLACES,MAINLY WOODS AND HEDGEROWS.THE RED CAMPION IS A PERENNIAL AND HAS EGG SHAPED ROOT LEAVES.IT HAS A DARK RED CALYX AND RED-PINK SPIDER LIKE PETALS.IT FLOWERS JUNE TO SEPTEMBER.
